result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:08 AM CO: Nordstrand, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: K Kittel. Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Passion Marie Galvin. Defendant Passion Marie Galvin not in court. INCLUDES:  22CM538 (BR 3 - RW)  and 22CF401 (BR 1 - STC). Court notes BR 3 would like a warrant issued with a non-appearance on his matter. Atty Harrelson makes statements. Atty Ellenwood asks for warrant, body only, adjoining states. Court issues body only warrants on both cases, adjoining states on 22CF401 . Adjourned: 10:11 am

8:37 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Passion Marie Galvin. Defendant Passion Marie Galvin not in court. Set for STC. Atty. Harrelson states DE is in custody in either Ramsey County or Hennepin County. ADA Ellenwood states restitution is the pending issue for resolution, not requesting a warrant. DE has Branch 3 case pending. Court sets STC, in person. Adjourned: 8:42 AM. kma
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on October 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Reschedule Request for 9/19/22 STC; filed by Atty Harrelson.  gll   to kp 9/16
Presigned.  gll

AMENDED

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Target in Hudson, WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- Defendant to sign pre-signed waiver of extradition. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

10:32 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Passion Marie Galvin. Defendant Passion Marie Galvin in court, in custody. INCLUDES STC (for Branch 2): 21CM230, 22CF415, 22CF435 and 22CM366, FPT: 22CF401. Atty. Harrelson states there is an agreement to Branch 2 cases and will be requesting plea/sentencing hearing on 21CM230, 22CM366, 22CF415 and 22CF435, DE will then waive extradition to MN to deal with pending cases and pre-sign waiver of extradition back to WI, requests to remove JT and reschedule as STC, DE will be entering Adult and Teen Challenge, requests bond modification. ADA Ellenwood responds, believes there will be a resolution. Court modifies bond in 22CF415 and removes JT from calendar. Court sets STC on 22CF401, in person appearance required. Adjourned: 10:43 AM. kma

8:40 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Passion Marie Galvin in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Passion Marie Galvin. Includes 21CM230, 22CF415 Extradition, 22CM366, 22CM345 (BR 1), and 22CF401 (BR 1). 10:18 AM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:   Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Eugenia Marie Galvin appeared from jail. INCLUDES 22CF401 (ARGN) and 22CM345 (PTC). Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading.  NG. Cout notes previously scheduled hearings. Atty. Harrelson makes objection regarding identity of DE, requests dismissal. ADA Smestad responds. Adjourned: 10:23 AM. kma
Filed by ADA Smestad. km
Arraignment on June 24, 2022 at 10:15 am.

10:58 AM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Passion Marie Galvin appeared from jail. INCLUDES 22CF401 (PH) and 22CM345 (PTC). S/T - Charles Welbourn, Hudson Patrol Officer. Direct by ADA Smestad. Cross by Atty. Harrelson. Redirect by ADA Smestad. Counsel arguments. Atty. Harrelson requests dismissal based on DE's improper identity. Atty. Smestad makes argument. Court finds DE's proper identity is unambiguous. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Adjourned: 11:34 AM. kma  Arraignment scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:15 am.

INCLUDES 22CF401 and 22CM345

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Target in Hudson, WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.
